name: Roo.Fx
desc:
A class to provide basic animation and visual effects support. Note: This class is automatically applied to the {@link Roo.Element} interface when included, so all effects calls should be performed via Element. Conversely, since the effects are not actually defined in Element, Roo.Fx must be included in order for the Element effects to work.


It is important to note that although the Fx methods and many non-Fx Element methods support "method chaining" in that they return the Element object itself as the method return value, it is not always possible to mix the two in a single method chain. The Fx methods use an internal effects queue so that each effect can be properly timed and sequenced. Non-Fx methods, on the other hand, have no such internal queueing and will always execute immediately. For this reason, while it may be possible to mix certain Fx and non-Fx method calls in a single chain, it may not always provide the expected results and should be done with care.


Motion effects support 8-way anchoring, meaning that you can choose one of 8 different anchor points on the Element that will serve as either the start or end point of the animation. Following are all of the supported anchor positions:

Value  Description
-----  -----------------------------
tl     The top left corner
t      The center of the top edge
tr     The top right corner
l      The center of the left edge
r      The center of the right edge
bl     The bottom left corner
b      The center of the bottom edge
br     The bottom right corner
Although some Fx methods accept specific custom config parameters, the ones shown in the Config Options section below are common options that can be passed to any Fx method.

config.name: easing
config.desc: A valid Easing value for the effect

config.name: afterCls
config.desc: A css class to apply after the effect

config.name: useDisplay
config.desc: Whether to use the display CSS property instead of visibility when hiding Elements (only applies to effects that end with the element being visually hidden, ignored otherwise)

config.name: stopFx
config.desc: Whether subsequent effects should be stopped and removed after the current effect finishes

config.name: callback
config.desc: A function called when the effect is finished

config.name: scope
config.desc: The scope of the effect function

config.name: remove
config.desc: Whether the Element should be removed from the DOM and destroyed after the effect finishes

config.name: concurrent
config.desc: Whether to allow subsequently-queued effects to run at the same time as the current effect, or to ensure that they run in sequence

config.name: duration
config.desc: The length of time (in seconds) that the effect should last

config.name: afterStyle
config.desc:
A style specification string, e.g. "width:100px", or an object in the form {width:"100px"}, or
a function which returns such a specification that will be applied to the Element after the effect finishes

config.name: block
config.desc: Whether the effect should block other effects from queueing while it runs

methods.name: fadeOut

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) Object literal with any of the Fx config options

methods.name: stopFx
methods.desc:
Stops any running effects and clears the element's internal effects queue if it contains
any additional effects that haven't started yet.

methods.name: frame

params.name: color
params.desc: (optional) The color of the border.  Should be a 6 char hex color without the leading # (defaults to light blue: 'C3DAF9').

params.name: count
params.desc: (optional) The number of ripples to display (defaults to 1)

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) Object literal with any of the Fx config options

methods.name: pause
methods.desc:
Creates a pause before any subsequent queued effects begin. If there are no effects queued after the pause it will have no effect. Usage: 

el.pause(1);

params.name: seconds
params.desc: The length of time to pause (in seconds)

methods.name: hasFxBlock
methods.desc:
Returns true if the element is currently blocking so that no other effect can be queued
until this effect is finished, else returns false if blocking is not set.  This is commonly
used to ensure that an effect initiated by a user action runs to completion prior to the
same effect being restarted (e.g., firing only one effect even if the user clicks several times).

methods.name: hasActiveFx
methods.desc: Returns true if the element has any effects actively running or queued, else returns false.

returns.desc: True if element has active effects, else false

methods.name: highlight

params.name: color
params.desc: (optional) The highlight color. Should be a 6 char hex color without the leading # (defaults to yellow: 'ffff9c')

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) Object literal with any of the Fx config options

methods.name: syncFx
methods.desc:
Ensures that all effects queued after syncFx is called on the element are
run concurrently.  This is the opposite of {@link #sequenceFx}.

methods.name: puff

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) Object literal with any of the Fx config options

methods.name: fadeIn

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) Object literal with any of the Fx config options

methods.name: sequenceFx
methods.desc:
Ensures that all effects queued after sequenceFx is called on the element are
run in sequence.  This is the opposite of {@link #syncFx}.

methods.name: slideIn

params.name: anchor
params.desc: (optional) One of the valid Fx anchor positions (defaults to top: 't')

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) Object literal with any of the Fx config options

methods.name: ghost

params.name: anchor
params.desc: (optional) One of the valid Fx anchor positions (defaults to bottom: 'b')

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) Object literal with any of the Fx config options

methods.name: slideOut

params.name: anchor
params.desc: (optional) One of the valid Fx anchor positions (defaults to top: 't')

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) Object literal with any of the Fx config options

methods.name: scale

params.name: width
params.desc: The new width (pass undefined to keep the original width)

params.name: height
params.desc: The new height (pass undefined to keep the original height)

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) Object literal with any of the Fx config options

methods.name: switchOff

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) Object literal with any of the Fx config options

methods.name: shift

params.name: options
params.desc: Object literal with any of the Fx config options
